subject: p13263843
History: -year-old female with likely pneumonia at outside hospital.
Findings: Single AP view of the chest. Postoperative changes again seen in the right thoracic cavity. Compared to prior, there appears to be less aerated lung on the right which could be due to enlarging effusion with possible underlying parenchymal abnormality. In addition, there is persistent left basilar opacity not significantly changed given differences in technique. Superiorly, the left lung remains clear. Right PICC and right pleural catheter are again noted.
Impression: Persistent left basilar opacity, compared to. This could represent atelectasis although infection is not excluded. Less aerated lung on the right when compared to prior, potentially due to collecting pleural fluid although developing parenchymal abnormalities are also possible.
